ARABIC: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَلَآ أَنسَابَ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَلَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then when the Trumpet is blown, that Day there will be no family ties between them; they will not be able to question one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When the trumpet blast is sounded no ties of lineage will hold among them, nor will they ask after one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: There will be no kindred relations nor any opportunity to ask about others or seek their assistance after the trumpet has sounded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So when the Trumpet is blown – so there will neither be any relationship among them* that day, nor will they ask about one another. (The disbelievers)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then, when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask of one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So when the trumpet is blown, there shall be no ties of relationship between them on that day, nor shall they ask of each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: For when the Trumpet is blown, that day there shall be no kinship any more between them, neither will they question one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when the trumpet is blown there will be no kinship among them that day, nor will they ask of one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When the trumpet is blown, on that Day there will be no ties of relationship between them; neither will they ask about one another:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when the Trumpet is blown there will be no lineage among them that Day, nor will they ask of each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When the Trumpet is blown, there will be no ties between them on that day, nor will they ask [about] each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no more relationships between them that Day, nor will one ask after another!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then, when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask of one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And when the Horn is blown, on that Day their ties of kindred shall be no more, nor will they ask each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When the Horn is blown, no relations between them will exist on that Day, and they will not ask after one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:101] And when the Trumpet is blown, the Horn, at the first or second blast, there will be no more ties [of kinship] between them on that day, for them to boast of among themselves, nor will they question one another, about such [ties], in contrast to their state in the life of this world, because of the gravity of the situation that will distract them from such [questioning] at certain points during the [Day of] Resurrection. At other [points] they are awake and [as is stated] in one verse: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other [Q. 37:50].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when the trumpet is blown) the blowing of the resurrection (there will be no kinship among them) people's common lineage will be of no benefit (that day) the Day of Judgement, (nor will they ask of one another) nor will they ask about that.
